results.title: The Island
results.creator_credit: Michael Ritchie, David Brown, Richard Zanuck and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on Peter Benchley’s novel and adapted for the screen by him, “The Island” unfortunately does not match up to Benchley’s box office hit “Jaws”. The story is set in the Caribbean, in the Bermuda Triangle, an area where pleasure crafts and fishing boats have a habit of mysteriously disappearing, along with their passengers and crew. Blair Maynard (Michael Caine) is a journalist who sets out, along with his son, Justin (Jeffrey Frank), to try and discover the reason for the disappearances. It is during a fishing trip in the accursed area that Maynard and his son are captured by pirates, who are supposedly descendants from seventeenth century pirates and who still live by the same code, that is, robbing and murdering all those who sail close to their island shores. Maynard is kept alive to serve the needs of “regenerating” the blood-line of the pirates, and Nau, King of the pirates (David Warner), takes to converting Justin to their heathen ways. But escape for Maynard becomes paramount and the action and thrills begin to build as the film heads towards its tumultuous climax. Cast also includes Angela Punch McGregor, Frank Middlemass, Don Henderson, Dudley Sutton, Colin Jeavons. Music composed and conducted by Ennio Morricone.

results.title: The Incredibles
results.creator_credit: Brad Bird, John Walker, Walt Disney Pictures and Pixar Animation Studios
results.brief_description: Fun, fun, fun. That is the verdict on the latest ingenious animated feature from Pixar. Based around a family of ‘supers’ (aka superheroes) “The Incredibles” introduces Robert “Mr Incredible”, consigned to a life of mind-numbing boredom in suburbia who longs for his glory days as a world saving super hero. Spiritually crushed by a pen-pushing insurance claim job, Robert toils under the daily grind in the suburbs with loyal wife Helen (“Elastigirl”) and their three children. Bob’s zest for life is revived when he is called upon by the mysterious Mirage to perform some planet-saving assignments, but he is unwittingly drawn into confrontation with an old foe who seeks to bring all the Supers down. Bob must rely on his family to help when the situation becomes desperate and the audience gets to discover how super, these Supers really are. Features the voices of Craig T. Nelson, Holly Hunter, and Samuel L. Jackson.

results.title: The Incredible shrinking man
results.creator_credit: Jack Arnold, Albert Zugsmith and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: This low-budget feature is a powerful and perverse example of American Cold War cinema. While holidaying with his wife, Scott Carey sails into a radio-active storm. He slowly becomes aware that his body is changing and he descends into despair as he continues to shrink until he is only a few inches tall. His familiar suburban world begins to transform into a nightmare jungle. The staircase becomes an impenetrable cliff wall and the family cat, a terrifying monster. Suprisingly the special effects stand the test of time. It is easy to laugh at the fears expressed in this film but the terror unleashed by the atomic bomb, and the resulting awareness of humanity’s mortality, still manages to disturb and confront. Ultimately “The Incredible Shrinking Man” turns out to be a less propagandic and more humane film than much of Cold War science-fiction.

results.title: The Irrepressible Jack Stone
results.brief_description: A heartbreaking but inspiring story about Jack Stone, the kid who lived every moment of his life to the fullest - as told by his mother. Created as part of ‘The Heart of the Story’, an ACMI Digital Storytelling Project in association with the National Heart Foundation of Australia (Victorian Division) in partnership with VicHealth. You can create your won Digital Story. Ask at the Information Desk or go to www.acmi.net.au/digitalstorytelling

results.title: Gumboots Australia for DOS
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. One 3 1/2 inch floppy disk and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Explore Australia and help solve a plethora of mysteries in Gumboots Australia. In this this adventure and educational game, the player is tasked with solving cases as an investigator for the Gumboots Enquiry Agency, a job that will take the player all over the country. The player will get to visit locations as varied as Kakadu to Coober Pedy in their hunt for the next clue. Getting there is its own challenge, as different modes of transportation can cost time and money. Random events along the way aid or hinder the player’s quest to solve the case.

results.title: Emulation of Gumboots Australia for PC
results.material_description: Floppy disk videogame. One 3 1/2 inch floppy disk and manual in cardboard box
results.brief_description: Explore Australia and help solve a plethora of mysteries in Gumboots Australia. In this this adventure and educational game, the player is tasked with solving cases as an investigator for the Gumboots Enquiry Agency, a job that will take the player all over the country. The player will get to visit locations as varied as Kakadu to Coober Pedy in their hunt for the next clue. Getting there is its own challenge, as different modes of transportation can cost time and money. Random events along the way aid or hinder the player’s quest to solve the case.

results.title: The Incredible San Francisco artists' soapbox derby
results.creator_credit: Amanda C Pope and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: In the spring of 1975, 104 artists of San Francisco let fly with imagination and creativity and built 75 “cars” and 32 trophies for an artists’ annual soapbox (billycart) derby. Entries were built from such diverse materials as wire, papier-mache, sage-brush and bread. They raised $20,000 for the San Francisco Museum of Modern Art.
results.title_for_label: The Incredible San Francisco artists’ soapbox derby

results.title: The Iron ladies
results.brief_description: Camp comedy, based on a true story, about a group of gay and transsexual men who join a volleyball team and are led to victory by an unassuming but determined coach. Drawing comic conflict from the protagonists preening and interpersonal problems, the film travels a fairly standard arch regarding tolerance difference and overcoming seemingly insurmountable odds. A huge hit in Thailand, this film also played in numerous festivals, including Toronto Film Festival. Followed by a sequel The Iron ladies 2 in 2003.

results.title: The Incredible journey
results.creator_credit: Fletcher Markle, Walt Disney and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A holidaying family leave their three pets: Bodger, a bull-terrior; Tao, a Siamese cat; and Luath, a Labrador retriever in charge of a family guest, Emile. When the guest goes off hunting but fails to inform the animals, the three pets begin an incredible journey, over 200 miles to reach their owners. With the majestic Canadian countryside as a backdrop, this film is based on the book by Sheila Burnford. Starring Emile Genest, John Drainie, Tommy Tweed and Sandra Algar.
